topic.title: Removing an Existing ESX Host from a Cluster

body.p:
The process for removing an existing ESX host from cluster is as follows:
Migrate all instances on the ESX host (to be removed) to other hosts in that cluster through vCenter client. Right click the Instance and select Migrate.
Select the required host within the cluster as shown below:
You must Power off the ovsvapp VM. Right click the ovsvapp VM (IP Address) and select Power Off.
Right click and select Delete from Disk.
Now put the host in the maintenance mode.
Right click the Host and select Enter Maintenance Mode.
Disconnect the VM, Right click and select Disconnect.
Remove the ESX host from the cluster.
